data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Data Centre Policy 2021 - Data Centre units - Electricity Supply - Existing
data.benefits: This scheme provides exemption on Electricity Duty, Dual-grid lines power supply and Transmission and wheeling charges.
data.eligibility:
1. A Data Center Unit is a dedicated secure space within a building I centralized location where computing and networking equipment is concentrated for the purpose of collecting, storing, processing, distributing or allowing access to large amounts of data. 
  2. Captive Data Centers shall not be considered under this policy.
data.conditions:
1. Policy is applicable for the proposals submitted after the notification of this policy. 

2. Investors shall not be eligible to claim financial incentives under the same head from Central and State Governments both. 

3. All incentives and benefits proposed under the policy shall be applicable post release of Letter of comfort 

4. This subsidy shall be given to only first 3 DC parks after notification of the policy.

data.nodal_agency: Department of IT & Electronics, Government of Uttar Pradesh
data.context: The Policy aims to build a conducive policy environment for the Data Center industry to flourish in the state. The locational advantage, strong IT ecosystem, readily employable quality talent are some of the key ingredients to keep Uttar Pradesh a promising destination for investment in Data Center industry.
data.objective:
1. To substantially increase production of Oxygen in Uttar Pradesh and thereby make oxygen available to contain the health crisis caused by Covid19 

2. To facilitate and promote investments in Oxygen manufacturing in UP while creating employment opportunities 

3. To establish Uttar Pradesh as a self-dependent State in production of Oxygen.
data.description:
Scheme provide assistance of: Electricity Duty: 100% exemption for 10 years post-commercial operation. Dual-Grid Power Supply: 

Applicable to the first eight data center parks. Transmission and Wheeling Charges: 

  • 50% exemption on intrastate wheeling/transmission charges for 25 years. 
  • 100% exemption on intrastate transmission charges for interstate sales for 25 years, providing significant cost savings for data center operators. 
  • 100% exemption on transmission charges for energy import for 5 years (applicable to projects commissioned within the policy period).

data.additional_info:
1. Data Center Unit is a secure space within a building or centralized location for computing and networking equipment to collect, store, process, distribute, or allow access to large amounts of data. 

2. Uninterrupted Water Supply: 24/7 water supply ensured for data center units in any Industrial Area Development Authority, both inside and outside the DC Park. Water treatment plants will be set up by DC parks as part of common infrastructure. 

3. Sub-Leasing Flexibility: DC parks can sub-lease land/buildings to DC units without any sublease or transfer charges. No fees/charges will be levied by the respective Authority on the transfer of land/building from DC Park developer to individual DC units. 

4. FAR Allowance: DC Parks and Units are allowed a Floor Area Ratio (FAR) of 3.0 + 1.0 (Purchasable). Basement parking, storage, and space used for DG sets installation are not considered part of FAR. 

5. Parking Area Requirement: 5% of the total built-up area must be allocated for parking, provided in open areas. These relaxations will be revoked if the land is used for purposes other than running a DC Park/Unit. DC Parks/Units must provide an undertaking of the estimated traffic and inform the respective Authorities, committing to additional parking if needed due to increased traffic. 

6. Ground Coverage: Up to 60% ground coverage is allowed for DC Parks/Units. 

7. Infrastructure Provision: Required infrastructure (electricity, water, sewer, road) will be provided to DC parks by respective Industrial Area Development Authorities where land is purchased from the Authority. 

8. Cross-Subsidy Surcharge Reduction: The cross-subsidy surcharge for a DC Unit starting commercial operation will be progressively reduced over 5 years to a maximum of 20% of its opening level. 

9. Power Distribution License: DC park developers/operators can seek a license for power distribution and consumption within the DC park. 

10. 24/7 Power Supply: Provided to DC Parks and DC Units, subject to the requirement of a dedicated power supply feeder arranged by the Park/Unit. 

11. Regulatory Stability: Regulations in force at the time of commissioning a DC Unit will apply for 25 years. The DC Industry can freely import renewable energy from outside the state and avail banking facilities in the respective states. 

12. Incentives for MSMEs/Startups: UP-based Data Center MSMEs/Startups providing innovative solutions in cloud business are eligible for incentives as per the UP MSME Policy or Startup Policy.
